ixlb Dimsum Eats- Westwood -0.review:
I recently had the pleasure of dining at ixlb Dimsum Eats in Westwood, and I must say, it was well worth the trip. As someone who struggled with the distance of their Hollywood location, I was thrilled to have a more convenient option nearby.

The dim sum selection at ixlb Dimsum Eats is truly outstanding. Each dish is freshly cooked right there, giving it that authentic and delicious taste. One dish, in particular, stood out to me - their steamed shrimp dumplings. The portion size was generous, and the flavors were absolutely delightful. The dumplings were perfectly cooked, with a tender and flavorful shrimp filling encased in a delicate and thin dumpling skin. I was blown away by the freshness and quality of this dish.

Not only was the dim sum exceptional, but the service at ixlb Dimsum Eats was also top-notch. The waitstaff was attentive and friendly, and the speed at which our food was served was impressive. We never had to wait long for our dishes to arrive, allowing us to enjoy our meal without any delays.

There is one small downside that I must mention, which is the minor issue of some of our dim sum missing. However, considering the overall excellence of the food and service, this was a minor hiccup that did not deter from the overall dining experience.

In conclusion, if you are in the Westwood area and craving some delicious dim sum, I highly recommend visiting ixlb Dimsum Eats. Not only will you be treated to a wide selection of fresh and flavorful dishes, but you will also receive fast and attentive service. And don't forget to try their incredible steamed shrimp dumplings - they are truly a standout dish.

Violet Bistro-0.review: I have been searching high and low for an authentic French onion soup in LA, and I finally found it at Violet Bistro! After visiting the Getty museum, I decided to stop by for dinner, and let me tell you, it was worth the wait. The rich and flavorful broth, topped with a perfectly melted layer of cheese and the most deliciously caramelized onions, just took me back to France. It was like a warm hug in a bowl. I was so thrilled to finally find a French restaurant that lived up to my expectations after 7 years of searching. The only downside was the limited street parking at 7 p.m., but the experience was well worth it. The first visit may have knocked it out of the park, but this dish alone makes Violet Bistro a memorable place for me. I will definitely be returning for more of their amazing French onion soup and to try other dishes on their menu.

Violet Bistro truly knows how to prepare authentic French cuisine, and this dish is a must-try for anyone longing for a taste of France in LA. I can now mark finding a great French restaurant off my list after 7 long years. Violet Bistro, thank you for a memorable birthday dinner!
